definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: A banal landscape of ugly new towers flanks both sides.
sentences.chinese: 馬路兩遍的是平凡醜陋的新摩天大樓的景象。

sentences.english: China's love for towering skyscrapers just got turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 中國對摩天大樓的熱愛一百八十度大轉彎。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electirc power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大樓還是電能的過度消費者與浪費者。

sentences.english: Unlike a skyscraper, your garden will grow weeds.
sentences.chinese: 和摩天大樓不同，你的花園會長出野草。

sentences.english: How many floors does that skyscraper have?
sentences.chinese: 那棟摩天大樓有幾多層樓？

sentences.english: The former now has more skyscrapers than the latter.
sentences.chinese: 前者如今擁有的摩天大樓比後者還多。

sentences.english: S was the first person to photograph skyscrapers, clouds and views from the airplane.
sentences.chinese: 是第一個拍摩天大樓，雲和從飛機上看到的景象的人。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electric power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大樓也是電力的奢侈消費者和浪費者。

sentences.english: He wanted the one about how people build skyscrapers.
sentences.chinese: 他想聽那個人們如何建造摩天大樓的故事。

sentences.english: Forget the soaring skyscrapers of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉上海的高聳的摩天大樓吧。

sentences.english: Today, Shanghai’s skyline is dotted by more than 400 skyscrapers.
sentences.chinese: 今天，上海的地平線上聳立着400多座摩天大樓。

sentences.english: The skyscraper rears high into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 這座摩天大樓高聳入雲。

sentences.english: To build another skyscraper in the city is beside the point.
sentences.chinese: 正在該城市再蓋一座摩天大樓的成績不必談了。

sentences.english: This skyscraper is the solid materialization of his efforts.
sentences.chinese: 這座摩天大樓是他的努力的現實體現。

sentences.english: Is it the skyscraper of the future, or just a pie-in-the-sky idea?
sentences.chinese: 這是未來的摩天大樓，還是一個異想天開的想法？

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大樓高聳入雲。

definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
tenement building, typically of 2-4 stories, with a shop on the ground floor and upper floors used for residential purposes (esp. in southern China)
